content:
What a wonderful gesture! Creating a playlist that resonates with seniors can really make the family dinner a memorable one.

I'd be happy to suggest some timeless Bollywood classics that are likely to get your grandma and other seniors in the family grooving! Here are some popular ones:

**Classic Romantic Duets**

1. "Aaja Sanam Madhur Chandni Mein" - Chori Chori (1956)
2. "Pyar Hua Iqraar Hua" - Shree 420 (1955)
3. "Mere Sapno Ki Rani" - Aradhana (1969)
4. "Kuch To Log Kahenge" - Amar Prem (1971)
5. "Tere Mere Sapne" - Guide (1965)

**Evergreen Solo Numbers**

1. "Jailhouse Rock" - Qaidi (1957)
2. "Main Zindagi Ka Saath Nibhata" - Hum Dono (1961)
3. "Ae Mere Watan Ke Logon" - Shaheed (1965)
4. "Chhoti Si Mulaqat" - Chhoti Si Mulaqat (1967)
5. "Gaata Rahe Mera Dil" - Guide (1965)

**Fun & Upbeat Tracks**

1. "Jaiye Aap Kahan Ja Rahen Hai" - Mere Sanam (1965)
2. "Dum Maro Dum" - Hare Rama Hare Krishna (1971)
3. "Yeh Chaand Sa Roshan Chehra" - Kashmir Ki Kali (1964)
4. "Kajra Mohabbat Wala" - Kismat (1968)
5. "Aasmaan Se Aaya Farishta" - Kaagaz Ke Phool (1959)

These songs should bring back nostalgic memories and get everyone in a joyful mood. You can also consider including some popular songs from the 1980s, like "Pyaar Ki Ye Ek Kahani" from Himalay Se Ooncha (1975) or "I Am a Disco Dancer" from Disco Dancer (1982).

Remember to keep the volume at a comfortable level, so everyone can enjoy the music without straining their ears.

Hope this helps, and I'm sure your grandma will have a fantastic time dancing to these classic Bollywood tunes!
